Activity objective:
Recognize the options of an educational platform.
Describe what a technology device is.
List the characteristics and uses of the most common technology devices.
Activity description: Using the website of the project, students research about different technology devices and their use. In addition, they learn how to properly take care of these devices.

Activity objective:
Identify the main parts of an image editor.

Activity description: Students use diverse devices in order to create a technology invention that solves a specific need. They use an image editor to indicate the devices that will be part of their inventions.

Activity objective:
Use an electronic source to search for information.
List the basic tools of an image editor.
Explain what netiquette is.
Activity description: Students research about image editing and learn how an image editor works. Additionally, students learn about natural resources.

Activity objective:
Use drawing tools.
Apply color to an image.

Apply effects to an image.
Save an image.
Activity description: Students create a postcard with the image of a valuable natural resource. They use the pencil to complete the scene, color the image and add text and effects to design an eye-catching material.

Activity objective:
Insert an image from a file.
Modify an inserted image to fit in the layout.
Draw lines.
Decorate an image.
Activity description: Students design an advertisement to show the importance of caring for natural resources. They edit the image by using different tools, among them the selection tool.

Activity objective:
Create a new image.
Insert a photo from file.

Delete segments of an image.
Apply effects to text.
Activity description: Students create a collage. They use different tools to create an collage about the natural resources of their country.

Activity objective:
Conceptualizing ideas for the infographic.

Adding decorative elements to enhance the infographic's appeal.
Entering and formatting text to convey clear and concise recommendations.
Balancing design elements to create an engaging and informative infographic.
Activity description: Students design an infographic with recommendations to protect the environment. They include elements to represent their idea; they also use the eraser, decorate the image and enter text.

Activity objective: Put into practice what has been learned.
Activity description: Let’s put our skills into practice! Students design a type of graphic material of their choice: postcard, advertisement, poster, infographic or collage. Their purpose is to invite others to protect a natural resource in their community as they practice their new skills.

Activity objective: Create an online video from images.
Activity description: Students use the graphic materials created in this project to produce a video promoting the care of natural resources. This video can be shared with families.

Project name: This is how the Internet works
Activity objective:
Recognize the main options of an educational platform.
Describe how the internet came about.
Explain briefly how the internet works.
Define the following terms: client, server, URL, ISP, DNS and IP address.
Identify internet services.
List specific recommendations to assess the reliability of an online source.
Activity description: Students use the website of the project to look into the beginnings of the internet and fundamental aspects of how it functions. In addition, they review practical recommendations to evaluate the reliability of online sources.

Project name: This is how the Internet works
Activity objective:
Enter concepts in an online board.
Add images and videos in an online board.
Share a board.
Activity description: It is time to share what students have researched, and to do so they create an online board with basic internet concepts. Students enhance this board with related images and videos.

Activity objective:
List operators that can be used in a search engine.
Identify the process to use the advanced options in a search engine.
Describe the importance of citing the sources of information used.
Activity description: Students learn new tips and “tricks” to find information on the web by using different operators. In addition, they learn about the importance of citing sources of information in their school assignments and other projects.

Use logical or boolean operators in searches.

Create a new website.

Activity description: Students put into practice what they have learned as they perform a search for the world’s best cities to live in. Students choose their favorite one and begin to create their own website and add these general data: name, population, area, motto and other interesting facts.

Use filters in a search engine to locate images with specific characteristics.
Add a new page to the website.
Add an image gallery to a webpage.
Insert a map in a webpage.
Activity description: Students use different tools in the search engine to find images with specific sizes, types and formats of the city they chose. They add these images to their website, as well as a map with the exact location.

Activity name: What is the climate like in my favorite city
Activity objective:
Use operators to search for more delimited content: related, intitle and inurl.
Search multimedia content on the web using filters to determine duration, quality and source.
Insert a video in a webpage.
Activity description: Students look into the climate and natural resources of the city they chose. To do it, they use new operators such as related, intitle and inurl. Then, they use the options in the search engine to locate videos and 360° videos that they include in their website.

Activity objective:
Use the advanced options in a search engine.
Use the filetype operator to locate certain types of files.

Create links on the website.
Activity description: In this activity students use the advanced search options and the filetype operator to learn about the economy and trade of the city they picked. Additionally, they search for live streaming webcams around the city. With the content gathered, they create a new section in their website.

Activity objective:
Add buttons with links on the website.
Define a footer on the website.
Verify the functioning of the website.
Publish the website with a specific URL.
Activity description: Students use the search options already learned to complete their website by adding a new section, where they show five interesting facts why they would recommend living in the city they chose. Also, the students make the final modifications and complete the process to publish the site.

Activity objective: Create a web portal linking to the sites produced in the project.
Activity description: With the teacher's support, students work in teams to build a portal with access to all of their classmates’ sites. This will provide people who visit the portal with access to interesting contents about cities around the world.

Activity description: What are the world’s most valuable sports teams? In this activity, students discover the monetary value of different sports teams and their growth rate during the last year. After working on the data table and performing basic calculations, they use conditional formatting to classify the information.

Activity name: Most followers on a social network
Activity objective:
Remove formats.
Create a chart.

Add and modify elements of a chart.
Work with shapes.
Change the page orientation.
Establish a printing scale.

Sort and filter records in a table.
Activity description: In this activity, students create a table to show the number of followers that artists, athletes or other celebrities have on a specific social network. They create and customize a statistics chart, use filters and set up the page options.

Activity objective:
Apply styles to tables.

Change the order of the spreadsheets.
Define a header and footer.
Place the chart on a separate sheet.
Insert a comment in a cell.
Activity description: Students create a table and a statistical chart to show the sales of one area of the entertainment industry, for instance the best-selling videogames of all time. They insert a header and footer on the sheets and reinforce the use of filters and conditional formatting.

Activity objective: Put into practice what has been learned.
Activity description: Students use a spreadsheet to suggest an entertainment option for their school. They complete the basic proposal in the spreadsheet and determine the approximate costs to obtain the budget.

Activity name: A survey to evaluate the project
Activity objective: Create an online survey.
Activity description: Students use a tool to design online surveys. This survey will help the evaluate the acceptance level of their proposal. They analyze the data obtained to identify ways to improve their project.

Activity description: Students research about video games and game design. They learn the main options of Gamefroot to create their own game.

Design levels and characters.
Program game logic and publish the game.
Activity description: Students use Gamefroot to plan screens, design the main character, add score and time, publish the game and create another level.

Activity objective:
Recognize the main options of an educational platform.
Explain what a drone is and its characteristics.
Describe the basic operation of a drone.
List applications of drones today.
Define what is ethics and its relationship with technology.
List essential ethical considerations when using technology tools.
Activity description: Students use the website of the project and other online sources to research about drones: their functioning and current uses. In addition, they learn about ethics and its importance when using technology tools.

Activity objective:
Identify the main options of a tool to design a comic.
Select and modify the background of the scenes.
Add characters in the scenes.
Add and modify text calls.
Save and share a story.
Activity description: It’s time to design a comic! In this activity, students use an online tool to create a comic strip that shows a concrete situation where a drone can be used in creative manner.

Activity objective:
Explain the usefulness of styles in a word processor.
Describe the advantages of using tables in a document.
Identify options for using references in a document.
Define what online advertising and its advantages are.
List the risks of online advertising.
Activity description: Students further their knowledge on word processors and they look into basic concepts of the business world which allow them to create their own business plan. Additionally, they learn about online advertising: definitions, advantages and risks. A key element of this activity is a brainstorm intended to choose the product or service that will be the core of their business plan.

Activity description: In this activity students create and set up a new document in order to start their business plan based on the product or service chosen. They use formatting tools to complete the first two sections: executive summary and company description.

Insert images.

Create a table by defining rows and columns.

Insert a footnote.
Prepare an organization chart.
Check the spelling of a document.
Activity description: Students continue working on their business plan. They develop the market analysis and the company organization. They work with images, lists, tables, organization chart, spelling checker and references.

Activity objective:
Create an artistic text.
Insert shapes.
Insert text boxes.
Align and position objects.
Sort the data of a table.
Perform mathematical operations in a table.
Apply styles to the tables.
Activity description: In this activity students prepare two new sections for their business plan: description of the products or services and financial projections. They use shapes, text boxes, artistic text and formulas in tables.

Highlight texts.

Activity description: Students prepare a new section for their business plan: the implementation stages. In addition, they add a cover and the table of contents. Finally, they adjust the settings to print the document.

Activity objective: Put into practice what has been learned.
Activity description: In this activity students complete their business plan by defining the marketing plan they will follow to promote their products or services. They put into practice what they have learned to complete the document and explore new tools to accomplish the final version of their proposal.

Activity objective: Share the proposals of undertakings.
Activity description: Students work in teams to prepare a business fair and show their plans to the school community and other actors in the city.

Activity name: Let's learn about the Internet of Things
Activity objective:
Recognize the main options of an educational platform.
Explain what the Internet of Things is.
Describe specific situations in which the Internet of Things can transform our daily life.
Present the consequences of the loss of privacy in social networks.
List actions to protect privacy in social networks.
Activity description: In this activity, students look into the Internet of Things. They learn what it is, its implications in the near future and other interesting facts. In addition, the importance of protecting their privacy in social media will be discussed.

Activity objective:
Identify the main options of a tool to create annotations or sketches.
Add and modify text in the sketch.
Draw shapes and arrows in the sketch.
Insert images in the sketch.
Save a sketch or annotation.
Share a sketch or annotation.
Activity description: Everyone taking notes! Students create a sketch to summarize what they have learned about the concept of the Internet of Things. The sketch includes shapes, texts with important ideas and representative images.

Activity objective:
Define what web design is.
List the main stages to design a website.
Identify basic HTML tags.
Present practical tips to design a good website.
Describe what the footprint is and the ways in which it is created.
Recommend actions to manage the footprint.
Activity description: Students learn more about web design and practical recommendations to build a good website. They also learn about the digital footprint and how it is created.

Activity objective:
Plan the design of a website.
Locate useful information to include on the website.
Download and optimize images to include in the website.
Curate other web resources to include in the site.
Organize resources within the website folder.
Activity description: Students specify the approach of the “Positive footprints” web campaign and complete the planning for it. Based on this planning, students search for information and resources for the web design.

Activity objective:
Start the creation of a new website.
Modify basic properties of the page.
Create and modify containers or blocks to define the structure of the page.
Enter text on a webpage and format it.
Define the website footer.
Preview the webpage in the browser.
Activity description: Students create the homepage for their website. In this page students include the title of the campaign, explain what it is about and its purpose. It is a call to action.

Activity objective:
Add a new page on the site.
Work with images on the webpage.
Insert and configure links.
Insert videos on the webpage.
Activity description: In this activity, students create the second page of the website. In this page, students add information about the main message of the “Positive footprints” campaign. They use images, videos and links to enrich the content.

Activity objective:
Add sections with collapsing text.
Include a gallery of images on the page.
Create a form on the website.
Insert buttons.
Activity description: Students create the third page of their website. In this page, they include experts’ opinion on the topic, as well as examples, practical cases or other content to complement the message of their campaign. They use tables to organize this information and create a form to receive contributions from people who visit the site.

Activity objective: Customize the website design.
Activity description: In this activity, students create the author’s page, including relevant information to leave their digital footprint. In addition, they verify the navigation system between pages and make the final adjustments to finish the website.

Activity objective:
Publish a website.
Embed external elements in the web site.
Update the changes made to the published version of the site.
Promote a website using different media.
Activity description: Students publish the website and use different means to promote their campaign: email, social networks and advertisements at their school.

Activity description: Students use Headliner to create a storyboard, gather materials, edit the video, add narration and music, and create a promotional video against bullying.

Activity description: Students learn about digital animation and digital citizenship topics. They explore Animaker and its main options.

Activity objective:
Create an animation with characters and scenes.
Add text, voice and export the animation.
Activity description: Students use Animaker to create short animations about netiquette, ergonomics, shopping online, security tips and digital reputation.

Activity objective:
Definir qué es una aplicación móvil.
Identificar las etapas del ciclo de vida de una aplicación móvil.
Explorar el entorno de desarrollo de App Inventor.
Describir qué es el consumo responsable y acciones clave para lograrlo.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes utilizan el sitio web del proyecto para aprender más sobre el desarrollo de aplicaciones móviles y familiarizarse con la temática de este proyecto. Además, conocen el entorno de trabajo de App Inventor.

Activity objective:
Crear un nuevo proyecto.
Configurar las propiedades de componentes de la aplicación: screen, botones y label.
Insertar un layout.
Agregar bloques de programación.
Comprobar el funcionamiento de la aplicación.
Exportar y descargar un proyecto.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes crean una aplicación móvil que muestra consejos que ayudan a mejorar los hábitos de consumo responsable.

Activity objective:
Añadir pantallas en la aplicación.
Agregar y programar un temporizador.
Controlar mensajes en pantalla.
Usar botones para moverse entre las pantallas de una aplicación.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes crean una aplicación que les ayudará a conocer más sobre el manejo de los residuos o basura que desechamos.

Activity objective:
Generar notificaciones dentro de la aplicación.
Utilizar la estructura condicional if.
Obtener el archivo apk de la aplicación.
Activity description: Los estudiantes diseñan una calculadora para obtener el resultado del CO2 emitido según el tipo de motor y la distancia recorrida. Utilizan los componentes Spinner y Notifier para diseñar esta aplicación.

Activity objective:
Crear listas interactivas en una aplicación.
Programar botones para abrir una URL.
Activity description: ¡A cuidar el medio ambiente! En esta actividad los estudiantes crean una aplicación que muestra diferentes consejos para cuidar el medio ambiente. Utilizan los componentes Listview, Webview y el ActivityStarter para visualizar los consejos.

Activity objective:
Crear una interfaz de registro e inicio de sesión.
Almacenar y consultar usuarios registrados.
Desplegar mapas dentro de una aplicación.
Activity description: Los estudiantes diseñan una aplicación que muestre mapas de diferentes lugares donde pueden realizar turismo ecológico. Utilizan el componente TinyDB1 para almacenar los usuarios registrados.

Activity objective:
Incluir y programar objetos para leer códigos de barra y QR desde una aplicación.
Utilizar una herramienta en línea para generar códigos QR.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes crean una aplicación para leer códigos de barra de productos de consumo diario y códigos QR con acceso a diferentes contenidos. También, aprenden a generar sus propios códigos QR.

Activity objective:
Incluir y programar sonidos.
Declarar variables y definir su estado inicial.
Programar objetos para que puedan ser arrastrados.
Diseñar un sistema de puntaje.
Establecer un tiempo límite en una pantalla.
Activity description: Los estudiantes crean un juego donde tienen que reciclar objetos según el material de fabricación. Utilizan los componentes Canvas, ImageSprite y Sound para controlar los elementos del juego.

Activity objective: Poner en práctica lo aprendido.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes diseñan su propia aplicación móvil sobre algún tema educativo o para resolver una necesidad de su institución. En esta actividad ponen en práctica lo aprendido y pueden explorar otras opciones.

Activity objective: Poner en práctica lo aprendido.
Activity description: Trabajando con el docente del área de Ciencias, los estudiantes investigan sobre las energías renovables. Con su grupo de trabajo diseñan una aplicación móvil para mostrar los usos de una energía renovable en la actualidad.

Activity objective:
Definir qué es una animación digital.
Enumerar los principales tipos de animación digital.
Brindar ejemplos de técnicas de animación digital.
Identificar las partes básicas de un editor de animaciones.
Crear una nueva animación y determinar sus propiedades.
Usar herramientas de dibujo.
Trabajar con fotogramas para definir el contenido que se observa en la animación.
Insertar un texto en una animación.
Exportar una animación en formato GIF.
Activity description: Los estudiantes investigan sobre las animaciones digitales: concepto, tipos y técnicas comunes. Además, utilizan el editor de animaciones en línea para crear un GIF animado.

Activity objective:
Crear capas, reordenarlas y asignarles un nombre.
Importar una imagen e incluirla en la animación.
Usar la herramienta “papel cebolla” para organizar los elementos.
Ajustar la vista de la línea de tiempo.
Usar efectos de interpolación.
Cargar y reproducir audio.
Exportar una animación en formato de video.
Activity description: Los estudiantes utilizan varias herramientas del editor de animaciones para crear un video explicativo sobre hábitos para prevenir enfermedades.

Activity objective:
Crear efectos de entrada.
Convertir objetos a botones.
Asignar nombres a los fotogramas.
Manejar fotogramas de control.
Programar un evento cuando el mouse se coloca sobre el objeto.
Definir un evento cuando se da clic al objeto.
Exportar una animación en formato HTML.
Activity description: Los estudiantes utilizan el editor de animaciones para crear un menú interactivo, con el fin de promover la alimentación saludable como medida para prevenir enfermedades.

Activity objective: Programar botones que reproducen un audio.
Activity description: En esta actividad los estudiantes diseñan una infografía interactiva para presentar hábitos que ayudan a mantener una vida saludable.

Activity objective:
Programar el evento “al presionar una tecla”.
Crear un hipervínculo en la animación.
Activity description: Los estudiantes programan teclas direccionales y un hipervínculo para crear una animación interactiva que muestre los beneficios de realizar actividades físicas.
